Which makes this next part even more

369.text:

375.text: in America, live on factory farms in long windowless sheds containing rows of stacked battery cages.

382.text: Up to 10 hens are packed together in one wire cage often unable to even spread their wings.

390.text: Standing on wire floors hens commonly suffer from foot and nail abnormalities, injuries as well as

396.text: feather loss due to physical and psychological stress.
